org.jnosql.artemis

Annotation Type ConfigurationUnit


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value={FIELD,METHOD})
 @Qualifier
public @interface ConfigurationUnit
    Expresses a dependency to a configuration and its associated persistence unit.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String database
      It creates both templates and repositories instances using from the respective database.
      String fileName
      the file name that is within the folder.
      String name
      The name of the configuration unit as defined in the settings file.
      String qualifier 
      DatabaseType repository
      Defines a source implementation to the repository.

    • Element Detail

      • name

        public abstract String name
        The name of the configuration unit as defined in the settings file.
        Returns:
        the unit name
        Default:
        ""

      • fileName

        public abstract String fileName
        the file name that is within the folder. The default value is jnosql.json
        Returns:
        the file name
        Default:
        "jnosql.json"

      • database

        public abstract String database
        It creates both templates and repositories instances using from the respective database.
        Returns:
        The database to templates and repositories classes.
        Default:
        ""

      • repository

        public abstract DatabaseType repository
        Defines a source implementation to the repository. This attribute is used where there are two or more mappers within an application classpath, e.g., mapper-document and mapper-column. Otherwise, it will return an Ambiguous dependency error.
        Returns:
        the repository implementation
        Default:
        org.jnosql.artemis.DatabaseType.SHARED

      • qualifier

        public abstract String qualifier
        Returns:
        A qualifier that provides various implementations of a particular repository type. E.g.: when there are several configurations to a specific bean type.
        Default:
        ""
